abstract: Amid a rising uproar over slipshod bank foreclosure practices, members of the Obama administration on Sunday expressed anger about the revelations, but urged caution as multiple investigations into the crisis unfold.
snippet: Amid a rising uproar over slipshod bank foreclosure practices, members of the Obama administration on Sunday expressed anger about the revelations, but urged caution as multiple investigations into the crisis unfold.
lead_paragraph: Amid a rising uproar over slipshod bank foreclosure practices, members of the Obama administration on Sunday expressed anger about the revelations, but urged caution as investigations into the crisis unfold.

headline.main: White House Urges Calm About Banks

abstract: Allianz is about to join the list of suitors for the Channel tunnel rail link with a £2 billion ($3.1 billion) bid for the railway put up for sale by Britain’s coalition government, The Sunday Times reported.
snippet: Allianz is about to join the list of suitors for the Channel tunnel rail link with a £2 billion ($3.1 billion) bid for the railway put up for sale by Britain’s coalition government, The Sunday Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Allianz is about to join the list of suitors for the Channel tunnel rail link with a £2 billion ($3.1 billion) bid for the railroad put up for sale by Britain’s coalition government, The Sunday Times reported.

headline.main: Allianz Is Said to Plan $3 Billion Bid for Channel Rail Link

abstract: The $67.5 million settlement of a securities fraud case by Angelo R. Mozilo highlights how indemnification can blunt the cost of a regulatory action, Peter J. Henning writes in the White Collar Watch column.
snippet: The $67.5 million settlement of a securities fraud case by Angelo R. Mozilo highlights how indemnification can blunt the cost of a regulatory action, Peter J. Henning writes in the White Collar Watch column.
lead_paragraph: Peter J. Henning follows issues involving securities law and white-collar crime for DealBook’s White Collar Watch.

abstract: Curtailing a moratorium sooner than expected, Bank of America said it would resume 102,000 foreclosures in 23 states where court approval is needed to go ahead.
snippet: Curtailing a moratorium sooner than expected, Bank of America said it would resume 102,000 foreclosures in 23 states where court approval is needed to go ahead.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America announced on Monday that it would resume home foreclosures in nearly two dozen states, despite the running controversy over how banks handled tens of thousands of cases of homeowners facing eviction.

headline.main: Largest Bank Will Resume Foreclosure Push in 23 States
headline.print_headline: Top U.S. Bank Set to Resume Its Foreclosures

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Andrew Martin

abstract: Curtailing a moratorium sooner than expected, the bank said it would resume foreclosures by next week in 23 states where court approval was needed to go ahead.
snippet: Curtailing a moratorium sooner than expected, the bank said it would resume foreclosures by next week in 23 states where court approval was needed to go ahead.
lead_paragraph: Curtailing a moratorium sooner than expected, Bank of America announced Monday that it would resume foreclosures by next week in 23 states where court approval was needed to go ahead, The New York Times reports.

headline.main: Bank of America Plans to Resume Foreclosures
